metadata.title: RA Family: Using the flash gap area to place user application code

sections.content:
Question:
Is it possible to use flash gap area (a space between vector table and Option-Setting Memory) to place user application code?
Answer:
Yes. Any user application code can be placed into the flash gap area.
The RA Family FSP defines a section “.flash_gap” in its linker script. Users can place any code using this section definition, as follows.
void user_function(void) BSP_PLACE_IN_SECTION(".flash_gap");
  Note 1:  In RA0/RA2 project, if “Fill Flash Gap” setting in FSP configurator > BSP property > RAxxx Family is enabled (“Fill Gap” is selected. The default value), some of BSP functions are placed in the flash gap area automatically. The space that can be used for the user application code is limited when enabled. For the actual available area size, please use project build result (.map file, etc.) to check.
Note 2: For support status of the section “. flash_gap” on each MCU, please  refer to the linker script file generated by FSP configurator.
Suitable Products
RA Family
